response.content: {"step1":"Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9‑inch round cake pan, then line with parchment for easy removal. Set aside; the batter will begin while the pan chills. This preparation ensures a moist crumb and prevents sticking, making the final cake rise evenly with a golden brown top.","step2":"Using an electric mixer, cream ½ cup (113g) salted butter and ¾ cup (150g) brown sugar until light and fluffy, about 4–5 minutes. Add 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, then “beat in” 2 large eggs, one at a time, ensuring each is fully incorporated before adding the next for a texture.","step3":"Meanwhile, sift together 1¾ cups (220g) all‑purpose flour, ¾ cup (75g) unsweetened cocoa powder, 2 teaspoons baking powder, ½ teaspoon baking soda, and a pinch of sea salt. Stir the mix until homogeneous, then gradually pour into the creamed base, alternating with ¾ cup (180ml) buttermilk, whisking just until combined.","step4":"Pour the smooth batter evenly into the prepared pan, tapping the tin gently on the counter to release air bubbles. Fill the pan ¾ full to allow room for expansion. Place the pan in the preheated oven and bake for 30–35 minutes, watching the cake rise and turn golden safely.","step5":"Remove the cake from the oven. Let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn onto a rack to cool. Prepare a chocolate ganache by whisking ½ cup (120ml) heavy cream and 1 cup (170g) melted dark chocolate over low heat. Drizzle over cake, allowing it to set with a finish for a sheen.","step6":"Slice the cooled cake into 8 even layers, plating them on individual plates. Dust each slice with cocoa powder or powdered sugar for a touch of elegance. Serve at room temperature with chocolate coulis or a scoop of vanilla ice cream, ensuring every bite delivers silky, rich chocolate bliss today."}
